trans-unit.source: Procurement

seg-source.mrk: Procurement

trans-unit.source: Procurement is displayed in the Job Planning and Processing view. All functions described below are executed or accessed from this view.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement is displayed in the Job Planning and Processing view.
All functions described below are executed or accessed from this view.

trans-unit.source: Process Planning Defaults

seg-source.mrk: Process Planning Defaults

trans-unit.source: After the process planning has been completed, the following data is available for the purchasing process:

seg-source.mrk: After the process planning has been completed, the following data is available for the purchasing process:

trans-unit.source: Process start date (will be inherited from the top level structure down to the bottom level)

seg-source.mrk: Process start date (will be inherited from the top level structure down to the bottom level)

trans-unit.source: Process end date (will be inherited from the top level structure down to the bottom level)

seg-source.mrk: Process end date (will be inherited from the top level structure down to the bottom level)

trans-unit.source: Planned hours (calendar entries, simulated inclusively)

seg-source.mrk: Planned hours (calendar entries, simulated inclusively)

trans-unit.source: Planned resources (existing calendar entries)

seg-source.mrk: Planned resources (existing calendar entries)

trans-unit.source: Procurement Planning

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Planning

trans-unit.source: To create purchasing activities from the calculated lines, at least the following two fields must be defined:

seg-source.mrk: To create purchasing activities from the calculated lines, at least the following two fields must be defined:

trans-unit.source: Procurement Channel – defines which purchasing process is used.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Channel – defines which purchasing process is used.

trans-unit.source: Procurement Finish Date – defines the due date. The date is transferred from the process planning. If no date is defined in the process, then the current date will be used.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Finish Date – defines the due date.
The date is transferred from the process planning.
If no date is defined in the process, then the current date will be used.

trans-unit.source: The following optional data can be displayed in this view:

seg-source.mrk: The following optional data can be displayed in this view:

trans-unit.source: Procurement Vendor No. – can be a different from the Vendor No. used for the original calculation.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Vendor No.
– can be a different from the Vendor No.
used for the original calculation.

trans-unit.source: Procurement Location Code – can be modified according to the inventory requirements. If nothing else is selected the default setting from the Job Card will apply.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Location Code – can be modified according to the inventory requirements.
If nothing else is selected the default setting from the Job Card will apply.

trans-unit.source: Procurement Cost Source – defines which wholesale price will be used for the purchase order.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Cost Source – defines which wholesale price will be used for the purchase order.

trans-unit.source: The “Procurement Planning” function is accessed on the Navigate tab of the Job Planning and Processing view by clicking Procurement > Planning in the Processing action group.

seg-source.mrk: The “Procurement Planning” function is accessed on the Navigate tab of the Job Planning and Processing view by clicking Procurement > Planning in the Processing action group.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning and Processing view with Procurement fields

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning and Processing view with Procurement fields

trans-unit.source: The planned positions can be easily identified after a successful procurement planning run (click the Yes value in the Procurement Planning field for an automated procurement planning). Automated Planning will only apply for those positions holding unplanned remaining quantities. Missing dates will be supplemented.

seg-source.mrk: The planned positions can be easily identified after a successful procurement planning run (click the Yes value in the Procurement Planning field for an automated procurement planning).
Automated Planning will only apply for those positions holding unplanned remaining quantities.
Missing dates will be supplemented.

trans-unit.source: Individual lines can be amended by clicking on the value in the Procurement Planning field.

seg-source.mrk: Individual lines can be amended by clicking on the value in the Procurement Planning field.

trans-unit.source: Example

seg-source.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: On the WBS position 1.1.3. for Manufacturing, three procurement lines were generated because the line was split into different process plans. The allocation of responsibilities is also based on process planning.

seg-source.mrk: On the WBS position 1.1.3.
for Manufacturing, three procurement lines were generated because the line was split into different process plans.
The allocation of responsibilities is also based on process planning.

trans-unit.source: : Job Processing Procurement view for WBS position 1.1.3

seg-source.mrk: : Job Processing Procurement view for WBS position 1.1.3

trans-unit.source: Procurement lines with no quantities must be planned manually. For example, position 1.1.6. is for instructions that will be charged by an expense. To generate a new procurement line, click the Procurement Planning field for the line and then click New Procurement on the ribbon of the Job Processing Procurement page. Each new procurement line will be assigned a unique Procurement No. and a quantity can be entered on the line.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement lines with no quantities must be planned manually.
For example, position 1.1.6.
is for instructions that will be charged by an expense.
To generate a new procurement line, click the Procurement Planning field for the line and then click New Procurement on the ribbon of the Job Processing Procurement page.
Each new procurement line will be assigned a unique Procurement No.
and a quantity can be entered on the line.

trans-unit.source: : Job Processing Procurement view for WBS position 1.1.6

seg-source.mrk: : Job Processing Procurement view for WBS position 1.1.6

trans-unit.source: All procurements belonging to a structure can be displayed in one general overview by selecting the top line in the Job Planning and Processing view and then clicking Per Block in the Procurement group on the Home tab.

seg-source.mrk: All procurements belonging to a structure can be displayed in one general overview by selecting the top line in the Job Planning and Processing view and then clicking Per Block in the Procurement group on the Home tab.

trans-unit.source: : All procurement lines for job J000001.01

seg-source.mrk: : All procurement lines for job J000001.01

trans-unit.source: Job Procurement Planning View

seg-source.mrk: Job Procurement Planning View

trans-unit.source: The procurement planning for all job lines can be viewed in the Job Procurement Planning page, accessed from the cc|project menu by clicking Planning > Procurement Planning.

seg-source.mrk: The procurement planning for all job lines can be viewed in the Job Procurement Planning page, accessed from the cc|project menu by clicking Planning > Procurement Planning.

trans-unit.source: : Job Procurement Planning showing job procurement lines in March 2019

seg-source.mrk: : Job Procurement Planning showing job procurement lines in March 2019

trans-unit.source: The fields in the General and Date FastTabs are used to filter the view. The actions on the ribbon allow for the accessing of Job Cards, Job Planning and Processing view as well as the ability to Release selected procurement lines.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the General and Date FastTabs are used to filter the view.
The actions on the ribbon allow for the accessing of Job Cards, Job Planning and Processing view as well as the ability to Release selected procurement lines.

trans-unit.source: Procurement Release

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Release

trans-unit.source: After the planning process is complete, procurement WBS positions with a status of Planning can be released by clicking Navigate > Procurement > Release.

seg-source.mrk: After the planning process is complete, procurement WBS positions with a status of Planning can be released by clicking Navigate > Procurement > Release.

trans-unit.source: Released procurement documents can be created during the release process. Created documents are displayed per procurement channel.

seg-source.mrk: Released procurement documents can be created during the release process.
Created documents are displayed per procurement channel.

trans-unit.source: : Released procurement lines for job J000001.01

seg-source.mrk: : Released procurement lines for job J000001.01

trans-unit.source: Rolling Calculation after Procurement Release

seg-source.mrk: Rolling Calculation after Procurement Release

trans-unit.source: Values from released procurement lines are displayed in the Total Direct Cost Released (LCY) field on the Job Rolling Calculation view.

seg-source.mrk: Values from released procurement lines are displayed in the Total Direct Cost Released (LCY) field on the Job Rolling Calculation view.

trans-unit.source: : Rolling Calculation for job J000001.01

seg-source.mrk: : Rolling Calculation for job J000001.01

trans-unit.source: Released amounts in procurement documents can vary from calculated values for any of the following reasons:

seg-source.mrk: Released amounts in procurement documents can vary from calculated values for any of the following reasons:

trans-unit.source: Release is not complete.

seg-source.mrk: Release is not complete.

trans-unit.source: Released value is higher than calculated.

seg-source.mrk: Released value is higher than calculated.

trans-unit.source: Procurement Direct Unit Cost is different in procurement lines and calculation lines.

seg-source.mrk: Procurement Direct Unit Cost is different in procurement lines and calculation lines.

trans-unit.source: Procurement values are moved to other WBS positions (Summarize Position).

seg-source.mrk: Procurement values are moved to other WBS positions (Summarize Position).

trans-unit.source: Time Entry

seg-source.mrk: Time Entry

trans-unit.source: Time entry refers to the recording of an employee’s actual time spent and expenses incurred while performing a job-related task. In cc|project, an employee can enter their time in a personal Job Journal batch or a stand-alone Terminal can be set up for multiple user time entry.

seg-source.mrk: Time entry refers to the recording of an employee’s actual time spent and expenses incurred while performing a job-related task.
In cc|project, an employee can enter their time in a personal Job Journal batch or a stand-alone Terminal can be set up for multiple user time entry.

trans-unit.source: In this section, the use of the Job Journal and a Terminal are explained for entering job-related tasks and expenses.

seg-source.mrk: In this section, the use of the Job Journal and a Terminal are explained for entering job-related tasks and expenses.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Select the Job Time Entry Administration check box in User Setup to allow a user can see all Job Journal Batches. If not set, a user can only see their own time entry journal. Refer to topic “User/Profile Setup” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Job Time Entry Administration check box in User Setup to allow a user can see all Job Journal Batches.
If not set, a user can only see their own time entry journal.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="User Profile Setup.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“User/Profile Setup” on page 1 </MadCap:xref>for more information.

trans-unit.source: Time Entry Job Journal

seg-source.mrk: Time Entry Job Journal

trans-unit.source: The Time Entry Job Journal is accessed from the navigation pane by clicking cc|project > Processing > Time Entry Job Journals.

seg-source.mrk: The Time Entry Job Journal is accessed from the navigation pane by clicking cc|project > Processing > Time Entry Job Journals.

trans-unit.source: The Time Entry Job Journal is a worksheet used for the direct recording of:

seg-source.mrk: The Time Entry Job Journal is a worksheet used for the direct recording of:

trans-unit.source: Hours spent (for service lines)

seg-source.mrk: Hours spent (for service lines)

trans-unit.source: Travel expenses (for travel expense lines)

seg-source.mrk: Travel expenses (for travel expense lines)

trans-unit.source: Consumables (i.e. for maintenance jobs)

seg-source.mrk: Consumables (i.e.
for maintenance jobs)

trans-unit.source: Each person should have an individual worksheet (batch) for time recording purposes.

seg-source.mrk: Each person should have an individual worksheet (batch) for time recording purposes.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Job Journal Batches are automatically created when persons are created as resources and the Person for Time Entry field is populated with the corresponding Resource No.

seg-source.mrk: Job Journal Batches are automatically created when persons are created as resources and the Person for Time Entry field is populated with the corresponding Resource No.

trans-unit.source: : Time Entry Job Journal for employee P001

seg-source.mrk: : Time Entry Job Journal for employee P001

trans-unit.source: Once the Job No. field is populated, a particular job line can be chosen in one of the following ways:

seg-source.mrk: Once the Job No.
field is populated, a particular job line can be chosen in one of the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Select the WBS position then the Job Procurement No.

seg-source.mrk: Select the WBS position then the Job Procurement No.

trans-unit.source: Select the Job Procurement No. directly.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Job Procurement No.
directly.

trans-unit.source: The first option will display the positions that have been released for time recording (independent of the allocated person). A released procurement line will be taken automatically if only one exists; multiple lines need to be selected separately.

seg-source.mrk: The first option will display the positions that have been released for time recording (independent of the allocated person).
A released procurement line will be taken automatically if only one exists; multiple lines need to be selected separately.

trans-unit.source: For the second option, leave the WBS field empty and click the drop-down arrow in the Job Procurement No. field. This will display only the lines that have been assigned to the person logged in or which do not have a dedicated assignment.

seg-source.mrk: For the second option, leave the WBS field empty and click the drop-down arrow in the Job Procurement No.
field.
This will display only the lines that have been assigned to the person logged in or which do not have a dedicated assignment.

trans-unit.source: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382826838" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 8</MadCap:xref> illustrates a job journal with recorded positions.

seg-source.mrk: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382826838" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 8</MadCap:xref> illustrates a job journal with recorded positions.

trans-unit.source: : Job lines entered in the Job Journal for employee P001

seg-source.mrk: : Job lines entered in the Job Journal for employee P001

trans-unit.source: During the posting process, job entries are generated with Type = Usage. These values can be found in the Total Direct Cost Usage RU (LCY) field in the Job Planning and Processing view.

seg-source.mrk: During the posting process, job entries are generated with Type = Usage.
These values can be found in the Total Direct Cost Usage RU (LCY) field in the Job Planning and Processing view.

trans-unit.source: : Posted job entries as displayed in the Total Direct Cost Usage RU (LCY) field

seg-source.mrk: : Posted job entries as displayed in the Total Direct Cost Usage RU (LCY) field

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: The Time Entry field is still set to Yes because the Procurement Planning Lines have not been set to Finished yet.

seg-source.mrk: The Time Entry field is still set to Yes because the Procurement Planning Lines have not been set to Finished yet.

trans-unit.source: Time Entry Terminal

seg-source.mrk: Time Entry Terminal

trans-unit.source: A terminal can also be used for time entry. The terminal enables a single workstation dedicated to time entry to be made available for several users.

seg-source.mrk: A terminal can also be used for time entry.
The terminal enables a single workstation dedicated to time entry to be made available for several users.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Posting availability for the terminal can be optionally allocated on the Procurement FastTab in the Jobs Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: Posting availability for the terminal can be optionally allocated on the Procurement FastTab in the Jobs Setup page.

trans-unit.source: Discuss setting up a Terminal with your COSMO CONSULT consultant.

seg-source.mrk: Discuss setting up a Terminal with your COSMO CONSULT consultant.

trans-unit.source: : Job Terminal

seg-source.mrk: : Job Terminal

trans-unit.source: After logging in, an employee enters their time the same as they would in the Job Journal. Afterwards, they can log off so that another employee can then enter their hours.

seg-source.mrk: After logging in, an employee enters their time the same as they would in the Job Journal.
Afterwards, they can log off so that another employee can then enter their hours.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Time Entry

seg-source.mrk: Mobile Time Entry

trans-unit.source: Job time entries can be entered using a web client or the Microsoft Dynamics NAV App with mobile devices, such as tablets or smart phones. In the Time Entry Journal from a web client, click/press the ellipses and then click/press Mobile Time Entry to begin the time entry process.

seg-source.mrk: Job time entries can be entered using a web client or the Microsoft Dynamics NAV App with mobile devices, such as tablets or smart phones.
In the Time Entry Journal from a web client, click/press the ellipses and then click/press Mobile Time Entry to begin the time entry process.

trans-unit.source: : Accessing the Mobile Time Entry function in mobile client

seg-source.mrk: : Accessing the Mobile Time Entry function in mobile client

trans-unit.source: The Mobile Time Entry screen shows the corresponding person/batch for the signed in user, as well as any entered time and capacities.

seg-source.mrk: The Mobile Time Entry screen shows the corresponding person/batch for the signed in user, as well as any entered time and capacities.

trans-unit.source: : Mobile Time Entry screen with resource, totals and capacity information

seg-source.mrk: : Mobile Time Entry screen with resource, totals and capacity information

trans-unit.source: To add a new entry, click/press the ellipses and then click/press New Entry.

seg-source.mrk: To add a new entry, click/press the ellipses and then click/press New Entry.

trans-unit.source: : Mobile Time Entry screen, accessing New Entry function

seg-source.mrk: : Mobile Time Entry screen, accessing New Entry function

trans-unit.source: In the Mobile Time Entry - New Record screen, enter the Job No. and WBS. In the Quantity field, enter the number of hours worked.

seg-source.mrk: In the Mobile Time Entry - New Record screen, enter the Job No.
and WBS.
In the Quantity field, enter the number of hours worked.

trans-unit.source: : Mobile Time Entry - New Record screen with Job No., WBS and Quantity

seg-source.mrk: : Mobile Time Entry - New Record screen with Job No., WBS and Quantity

trans-unit.source: Click OK to finish the new entry. The totals are updated in the Mobile Time Entry screen.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to finish the new entry.
The totals are updated in the Mobile Time Entry screen.

trans-unit.source: : Mobile Time Entry screen with updated totals

seg-source.mrk: : Mobile Time Entry screen with updated totals

trans-unit.source: More entries can be added using the “New Entry” function.

seg-source.mrk: More entries can be added using the “New Entry” function.

trans-unit.source: Entries made using the Mobile Time Entry are automatically added to the Job Time Entry journal in cc|project, ready for further processing.

seg-source.mrk: Entries made using the Mobile Time Entry are automatically added to the Job Time Entry journal in cc|project, ready for further processing.

trans-unit.source: : Mobile Time Entries in Job Time Entry journal in cc|project

seg-source.mrk: : Mobile Time Entries in Job Time Entry journal in cc|project

trans-unit.source: Discuss setting up mobile access with your COSMO CONSULT consultant.

seg-source.mrk: Discuss setting up mobile access with your COSMO CONSULT consultant.

trans-unit.source: Purchase Processes

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Processes

trans-unit.source: Direct purchases can be triggered in the following ways:

seg-source.mrk: Direct purchases can be triggered in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Create a Purchase Quote

seg-source.mrk: Create a Purchase Quote

trans-unit.source: Create a Requisition Worksheet line

seg-source.mrk: Create a Requisition Worksheet line

trans-unit.source: Create a Purchase Order directly

seg-source.mrk: Create a Purchase Order directly

trans-unit.source: As <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382827577" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 18</MadCap:xref> illustrates, a quote, requisition line and order have been created for the purchased items job lines.

seg-source.mrk: As <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382827577" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 18</MadCap:xref> illustrates, a quote, requisition line and order have been created for the purchased items job lines.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning Processing view for purchased items

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning Processing view for purchased items

trans-unit.source: Purchase Quotes and Requisition Worksheet lines will create Purchase Orders. To open the Purchase Quote or Order from the job line, click the Yes value in the relevant document field or in the Procurement Release field. Requisition Worksheets cannot be processed from the job views and therefore must be opened from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > Purchase > Planning.

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Quotes and Requisition Worksheet lines will create Purchase Orders.
To open the Purchase Quote or Order from the job line, click the Yes value in the relevant document field or in the Procurement Release field.
Requisition Worksheets cannot be processed from the job views and therefore must be opened from the navigation pane by clicking Departments > Purchase > Planning.

trans-unit.source: During the Purchase Order process, differences for quantity and/or costs in regards to calculation are possible.

seg-source.mrk: During the Purchase Order process, differences for quantity and/or costs in regards to calculation are possible.

trans-unit.source: : Costs from posting purchase-related procurement lines

seg-source.mrk: : Costs from posting purchase-related procurement lines

trans-unit.source: Purchase Quote Administration

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Quote Administration

trans-unit.source: Three informational fields in the Processing FastTab of the Purchase Quote are transferring to the Purchase Receipt Header, Purchase Invoice Header and Purchase Credit Memo Header upon posting.

seg-source.mrk: Three informational fields in the Processing FastTab of the Purchase Quote are transferring to the Purchase Receipt Header, Purchase Invoice Header and Purchase Credit Memo Header upon posting.

trans-unit.source: Transfer Purchase Conditions from Purchase Quote

seg-source.mrk: Transfer Purchase Conditions from Purchase Quote

trans-unit.source: Purchase prices and line discounts can be transferred from the purchase quote to the master data (Item). In this example, the purchase quote created during Procurement has been opened and pricing has been updated according to the vendor. The price remains but a small discount has been added. Currently, there are no purchase prices or line discounts assigned to this item (as displayed in the Purchase Line Details FactBox).

seg-source.mrk: Purchase prices and line discounts can be transferred from the purchase quote to the master data (Item).
In this example, the purchase quote created during Procurement has been opened and pricing has been updated according to the vendor.
The price remains but a small discount has been added.
Currently, there are no purchase prices or line discounts assigned to this item (as displayed in the Purchase Line Details FactBox).

trans-unit.source: : Purchase Quote created from procurement, preparing to run Transfer Purchase Conditions function

seg-source.mrk: : Purchase Quote created from procurement, preparing to run Transfer Purchase Conditions function

trans-unit.source: When the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function is run, a message appears to select if this is general pricing or job-specific pricing.

seg-source.mrk: When the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function is run, a message appears to select if this is general pricing or job-specific pricing.

trans-unit.source: If General Pricing is selected, the purchase price and/or line discount is transferred without any job information.

seg-source.mrk: If General Pricing is selected, the purchase price and/or line discount is transferred without any job information.

trans-unit.source: IfJob specific price is selected, the purchase price and/or line discount is transferred with job information so that the pricing is relevant only for the job.

seg-source.mrk: IfJob specific price is selected, the purchase price and/or line discount is transferred with job information so that the pricing is relevant only for the job.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the Job specific price option is selected and a confirmation message appears with the results.

seg-source.mrk: In this example, the Job specific price option is selected and a confirmation message appears with the results.

trans-unit.source: : Confirmation message from running the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function

seg-source.mrk: : Confirmation message from running the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function

trans-unit.source: In the Purchase Line Details FactBox, notice that both Purchase Prices and Purchase Line Discounts indicate purchasing conditions have been created. Clicking the Purchase Prices/Purchase Line Discount value opens the Get Purchase Price and Get Purchase Line Disc. pages, which show the job-specific information.

seg-source.mrk: In the Purchase Line Details FactBox, notice that both Purchase Prices and Purchase Line Discounts indicate purchasing conditions have been created.
Clicking the Purchase Prices/Purchase Line Discount value opens the Get Purchase Price and Get Purchase Line Disc.
pages, which show the job-specific information.

trans-unit.source: : Job-specific purchase price and line discount information

seg-source.mrk: : Job-specific purchase price and line discount information

trans-unit.source: Notice that not only is the job number assigned but also the Main Job No. This means that the special pricing is valid for any job created for the main job. If this item and vendor combination is used in other jobs not related to this main job, the special pricing is not used.

seg-source.mrk: Notice that not only is the job number assigned but also the Main Job No.
This means that the special pricing is valid for any job created for the main job.
If this item and vendor combination is used in other jobs not related to this main job, the special pricing is not used.

trans-unit.source: The Source Quote No. and Source Version No. fields provide historical information to indicate where the pricing originated. Clicking Actions > Show Source Document opens the Purchase Quote Archive page.

seg-source.mrk: The Source Quote No.
and Source Version No.
fields provide historical information to indicate where the pricing originated.
Clicking Actions > Show Source Document opens the Purchase Quote Archive page.

trans-unit.source: : Purchase Quote Archive created from running Transfer Purchase Conditions function

seg-source.mrk: : Purchase Quote Archive created from running Transfer Purchase Conditions function

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Ideally, all costing/pricing should be handled in the job budgeting phase and, therefore , the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function is most beneficial when used with the cc|purchase quotes manager.

seg-source.mrk: Ideally, all costing/pricing should be handled in the job budgeting phase and, therefore , the “Transfer Purchase Conditions” function is most beneficial when used with the cc|purchase quotes manager.

trans-unit.source: Inventory Requests

seg-source.mrk: Inventory Requests

trans-unit.source: Inventory Requests are used for inventory items. The Inventory Request will generate demand for procurement requisitioning in the same way a sales order generates demand.

seg-source.mrk: Inventory Requests are used for inventory items.
The Inventory Request will generate demand for procurement requisitioning in the same way a sales order generates demand.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning Processing view for indirect and direct inventory requests

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning Processing view for indirect and direct inventory requests

trans-unit.source: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382828680" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 20</MadCap:xref>, two inventory requests are set to be created:

seg-source.mrk: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382828680" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 20</MadCap:xref>, two inventory requests are set to be created:

trans-unit.source: WBS position 1.2.1. (Apron Conveyor) is an indirect inventory request. It is needed for produced quantities from the Production Order to post it to the job.

seg-source.mrk: WBS position 1.2.1.
(Apron Conveyor) is an indirect inventory request.
It is needed for produced quantities from the Production Order to post it to the job.

trans-unit.source: WBS position 1.2.3. (Documentation) is a direct inventory request.

seg-source.mrk: WBS position 1.2.3.
(Documentation) is a direct inventory request.

(Base) field contains the required quantity demand.

Req.
check box is selected in the Procurement FastTab on the Jobs Setup page.

trans-unit.source: Additional Procurement Processes

seg-source.mrk: Additional Procurement Processes

trans-unit.source: The previous sections described the commonly used procurement processes. This section describes some additional processes.

This section describes some additional processes.

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: A new job is used in these sections to separate processing functionality.

seg-source.mrk: Service Module Integration

trans-unit.source: If a job line has Procurement Channel = Service Order, a new Service Order will be created during the release process with a link to the job line. The service item can be added manually in a service line or set up in the procurement line.

seg-source.mrk: If a job line has Procurement Channel = Service Order, a new Service Order will be created during the release process with a link to the job line.
The service item can be added manually in a service line or set up in the procurement line.

trans-unit.source: Job Order

seg-source.mrk: Job Order

trans-unit.source: A Job Order is a summarized procurement view for a part of a job based on the normal procurement lines. This is an additional document to the existing procurement documents and provides a better overview for a job within a job.

seg-source.mrk: A Job Order is a summarized procurement view for a part of a job based on the normal procurement lines.
This is an additional document to the existing procurement documents and provides a better overview for a job within a job.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: This section uses a different job without purchase processing to show job order procurement.

seg-source.mrk: This section uses a different job without purchase processing to show job order procurement.

trans-unit.source: To create a Job Order for a procurement line(s), the Procurement by Job Order check box must be selected, either directly on the line or can be preset on the component.

seg-source.mrk: To create a Job Order for a procurement line(s), the Procurement by Job Order check box must be selected, either directly on the line or can be preset on the component.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning and Processing with WBS position 1.2.2.4 set for job order procurement

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning and Processing with WBS position 1.2.2.4 set for job order procurement

trans-unit.source: Example

seg-source.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: The four lines selected in Fig. 36 belong to the same procurement process but each has a different Procurement Channel. To manage the processing of each channel in one overview document, the Procurement by Job Order check box is selected on the Assembly line and then all lines to be included in the document are highlighted.

seg-source.mrk: The four lines selected in <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref382908986" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 36</MadCap:xref> belong to the same procurement process but each has a different Procurement Channel.

To manage the processing of each channel in one overview document, the Procurement by Job Order check box is selected on the Assembly line and then all lines to be included in the document are highlighted.

trans-unit.source: After the procurement planning process, cc|project will create a Job Order document in addition to all other procurement documents.

seg-source.mrk: After the procurement planning process, cc|project will create a Job Order document in addition to all other procurement documents.

trans-unit.source: : Job Order with lines from procurement planning

seg-source.mrk: : Job Order with lines from procurement planning

trans-unit.source: The lines in the Job Order may be used like normal procurement lines; the same functionality is available. However, to release lines for creating procurement documents, click Functions > Release All or Release Line for a single line.

seg-source.mrk: The lines in the Job Order may be used like normal procurement lines; the same functionality is available.
However, to release lines for creating procurement documents, click Functions > Release All or Release Line for a single line.

trans-unit.source: When the procurement documents (purchase orders and inventory requests) are posted, the Procurement Status on the released procurement lines is automatically set to Finished if the:

seg-source.mrk: When the procurement documents (purchase orders and inventory requests) are posted, the Procurement Status on the released procurement lines is automatically set to Finished if the:

trans-unit.source: Post Released Quantity Only check box is selected on the Procurement FastTab in the Jobs Setup page

seg-source.mrk: Post Released Quantity Only check box is selected on the Procurement FastTab in the Jobs Setup page

trans-unit.source: full quantity has been allocated

seg-source.mrk: full quantity has been allocated

trans-unit.source: For time entry lines, there is no such automation because usually no direct quantity matching can be achieved. Therefore, these lines are set to finished manually by clicking Navigate > Procurement > Set Finished.

seg-source.mrk: For time entry lines, there is no such automation because usually no direct quantity matching can be achieved.
Therefore, these lines are set to finished manually by clicking Navigate > Procurement > Set Finished.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: This function can be used on any lines that need to be set as finished.

seg-source.mrk: This function can be used on any lines that need to be set as finished.
